input: Analyze live turbine data, adjust parameters within safety constraints, monitor the results, and report performance improvements.

inputs.name: L
inputs.input_data: Real-time measurements (RPM, temperature, vibration, power output)

inputs.name: S
inputs.input_data: Numeric thresholds (max RPM: 1200, max temp: 800°C, vibration limit: 5mm/s)
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: T
inputs.bound_reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

inputs.name: C
inputs.source_origin: Computed from Live Turbine Sensor Data
inputs.input_data: Calculated efficiency, average power output over 15-minute window

inputs.name: P
inputs.source_origin: Computed from Current Performance Metrics and Safety Constraint Parameters
inputs.input_data: Proposed adjustments (blade angle ±5°, RPM target range: 1000-1150)

steps:
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Stream and validate sensor data quality
Produces: Cleaned sensor dataset (15-minute window)
Stores/Sends To: Local buffer memory

Uses: Cleaned sensor dataset, Safety Constraint Parameters
Action: Validate data against safety thresholds
Produces: Safety compliance status (boolean)
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring dashboard

Uses: Cleaned sensor dataset
Action: Calculate current performance metrics
Produces: Efficiency percentage, power output average
Stores/Sends To: Local buffer memory

Uses: Current Performance Metrics, Target Performance Metrics
Action: Compare actual vs target performance
Produces: Performance gap analysis
Stores/Sends To: Adjustment algorithm input queue

Uses: Performance gap analysis, Safety Constraint Parameters
Action: Generate constrained parameter adjustments
Produces: Parameter adjustment plan
Stores/Sends To: Turbine control system API

Uses: Parameter adjustment plan
Action: Apply validated parameter changes to turbine
Produces: Updated turbine configuration
Stores/Sends To: Turbine control system (https://api.turbinecontrol.com/v2/parameters)

Uses: Updated turbine configuration, Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Monitor post-adjustment performance
Produces: Time-series comparison dataset
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring dashboard database

Uses: Time-series comparison dataset, Target Performance Metrics
Action: Generate performance improvement report
Produces: PDF report with visualizations
Stores/Sends To: User email (via SendGrid API) and document storage (AWS S3://reports/turbine/)
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Live Turbine Sensor Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Turbine Sensor API endpoint (https://api.turbinesensors.com/v1/live-data)
   Input Data: Real-time measurements (RPM, temperature, vibration, power output)
   Bound Reference: None

2. Safety Constraint Parameters
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Engineering team
   Input Data: Numeric thresholds (max RPM: 1200, max temp: 800°C, vibration limit: 5mm/s)
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

3. Target Performance Metrics
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Operations management
   Input Data: Desired output targets (min power: 2.5MW, efficiency: ≥92%)
   Bound Reference: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

4. Current Performance Metrics
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Computed from Live Turbine Sensor Data
   Input Data: Calculated efficiency, average power output over 15-minute window
   Bound Reference: Input 1 (Live Turbine Sensor Data)
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

5. Parameter Adjustment Plan
   Source Type: DERIVABLE
   Source Origin: Computed from Current Performance Metrics and Safety Constraint Parameters
   Input Data: Proposed adjustments (blade angle ±5°, RPM target range: 1000-1150)
   Bound Reference: Inputs 2,4
   Note: [DEPTH STOP - Terminal input, do not further decompose]

Outputs:
1. Adjusted Turbine Parameters
2. Continuous Monitoring Dashboard
3. Performance Improvement Report (PDF)

Steps:
Step 1:
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Stream and validate sensor data quality
Produces: Cleaned sensor dataset (15-minute window)
Stores/Sends To: Local buffer memory

Step 2:
Uses: Cleaned sensor dataset, Safety Constraint Parameters
Action: Validate data against safety thresholds
Produces: Safety compliance status (boolean)
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring dashboard

Step 3:
Uses: Cleaned sensor dataset
Action: Calculate current performance metrics
Produces: Efficiency percentage, power output average
Stores/Sends To: Local buffer memory

Step 4:
Uses: Current Performance Metrics, Target Performance Metrics
Action: Compare actual vs target performance
Produces: Performance gap analysis
Stores/Sends To: Adjustment algorithm input queue

Step 5:
Uses: Performance gap analysis, Safety Constraint Parameters
Action: Generate constrained parameter adjustments
Produces: Parameter adjustment plan
Stores/Sends To: Turbine control system API

Step 6:
Uses: Parameter adjustment plan
Action: Apply validated parameter changes to turbine
Produces: Updated turbine configuration
Stores/Sends To: Turbine control system (https://api.turbinecontrol.com/v2/parameters)

Step 7:
Uses: Updated turbine configuration, Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Monitor post-adjustment performance
Produces: Time-series comparison dataset
Stores/Sends To: Monitoring dashboard database

Step 8:
Uses: Time-series comparison dataset, Target Performance Metrics
Action: Generate performance improvement report
Produces: PDF report with visualizations
Stores/Sends To: User email (via SendGrid API) and document storage (AWS S3://reports/turbine/)

aeb_analysis.aeb_analysis_raw:
### Step-by-Step Analysis --- **Step 1** **Step:** Stream and validate sensor data quality **Is AEB:** No **Reason:** Combines two distinct actions (streaming and validating), violating single intent. Validation logic is explicitly excluded from AEBs. **Suggest:** Split into: 1. Stream sensor data → AEB (single intent, interacts with sensor API). 2. Validate sensor data quality → Not an AEB (contains validation logic). --- **Step 2** **Step:** Validate data against safety thresholds **Is AEB:** No **Reason:** Explicitly involves validation logic, which is prohibited in AEBs. **Suggest:** Replace with a direct safety check API call (e.g., `check_safety_thresholds(data)`), but validation logic must reside outside AEBs. --- **Step 3** **Step:** Calculate current performance metrics **Is AEB:** Yes **Reason:** Single intent (calculation), no branching/sequencing, and can be implemented as a function (e.g., `calculate_metrics(data)`). --- **Step 4** **Step:** Compare actual vs target performance **Is AEB:** Yes **Reason:** Single intent (comparison), no branching/sequencing, and can be implemented as a function (e.g., `compare_performance(actual, target)`). --- **Step 5** **Step:** Generate constrained parameter adjustments **Is AEB:** No **Reason:** "Constrained" implies validation/branching logic (e.g., filtering adjustments that violate safety parameters). **Suggest:** Split into: 1. Generate raw parameter adjustments → AEB (e.g., `generate_adjustments(gap)`). 2. Filter adjustments against safety constraints → Not an AEB (contains validation). --- **Step 6** **Step:** Apply validated parameter changes to turbine **Is AEB:** Yes **Reason:** Single intent (API call to update turbine parameters), interacts with one system boundary (turbine control API). --- **Step 7** **Step:** Monitor post-adjustment performance **Is AEB:** No **Reason:** "Monitor" implies ongoing sequencing (e.g., collecting data over time). Produces a time-series dataset, which requires aggregation logic. **Suggest:** Split into: 1. Collect post-adjustment sensor data → AEB (interacts with sensor API). 2. Aggregate time-series data → Not an AEB (contains sequencing/aggregation logic). --- **Step 8** **Step:** Generate performance improvement report **Is AEB:** No **Reason:** Interacts with two system boundaries (SendGrid API and AWS S3) and combines report generation with distribution. **Suggest:** Split into: 1. Generate PDF report → AEB (e.g., `generate_report(data)`). 2. Send report via email → AEB (interacts with SendGrid API). 3. Store report in AWS S3 → AEB (interacts with S3 API). --- ### Summary of Non-AEB Steps and Breakdown | Original Step | Split Into | |---------------|------------| | Step 1 | Stream sensor data → AEB
Validate sensor data quality → Not an AEB | | Step 2 | Use safety check API → AEB (if validation logic is externalized) | | Step 5 | Generate raw adjustments → AEB
Filter adjustments → Not an AEB | | Step 7 | Collect post-adjustment data → AEB
Aggregate time-series → Not an AEB | | Step 8 | Generate report → AEB
Email report → AEB
Store report in S3 → AEB | All AEBs must be pure functions/API calls with no internal logic for validation, branching, or sequencing.
